pages.text:
The &1Corporea Retainer&0 is an addon of sorts to the $(l:1_items/interceptor)&1Corporea Interceptor&0$(/l).
Placing one of these adjacent to an interceptor allows for the interceptor to pass along to it the original corporea request, if it's intercepted.
When this happens, the retainer remembers which corporea object in the network initiated the request

as well as the contents of said request.
Once the &1Corporea Retainer&0 receives a redstone signal after it's been informed of a request, it'll have the original requestor redo the exact same request.
For example, a funnel might request &1Wooden Planks&0 from the network.
An interceptor intercepts the request and passes a signal along to craft the planks.
The retainer then gets a signal, allowing for the original funnel to redo the

request and get its planks.
As the &1Corporea Retainer&0 acts as an addon to the interceptor, it can use it to interact with the network, thus not needing a spark itself.
The retainer can only hold on to one request at a time, and will not accept another until the last one is fulfilled.
A &1Redstone Comparator&0 can read if there's a request to be done or not.
